lines.text:
[narrating]
There's a kind of freedom in being completely screwed... because you know things can't get any worse.

Everybody is talking about the job you are doing. It's all over town! Larry London called my father. Said how bright you were. How gentle. How perceptive. If you weren't all those things, do you think Vic would be out this afternoon getting you a gun permit?
I want you to take this opportunity. Totally legitimate work for $1,000 dollars a week. And I know that you're not gonna disappoint me.
Well, I don't see how I could say no.

[leans back in his chair]
This is not a yes.
[takes a walnut and cracks it open in his hand]

[still crushing the shell]
I want to hear yes.
Sir, I don't know where this talk of marriage began, but I'm really not ready. I'd really like to sample life a little bit first.
Wait. No, wait. Clark, after you get married you sample life. I mean, this is what men do. Marriage is an institution. It's the bedrock of society.

[hands Clark a fake passport]
Is that a piece of work or what?
What is this? "Rodolfo Lasparri"?
Clark, I gotta tell you. The odds are pretty good we're all gonna be on a plane to Palermo, Sicily tonight, at midnight, *if* we're still walking.
I don't want to go to Palermo, Sicily!
Have you ever been there?
No, of course not!
Then you really can't make an informed judgement, can you, Rodolfo?
My heart was pounding as I crossed the dance floor. In a few minutes I would be free or dead...or Rodolfo Lasparri of Palermo, Sicily!

[Looking around the dorm]
So, this is college.
[Chuckles]
I didn't miss nothing.
[In Little Italy]
This is it?
Yeah. Safest neighborhood in New York.
[Gunshot in the background]
Part II"]
Nothing." In that one moment, Michael Corleone says that all corruption is equal - that there is no separation between politics and gangsterism.
It's a crime.
Now you're speaking in generalities.
I'm illegally transporting endangered species! Please, sir, I'd like to be let out.
Wait a minute. This is an impossibility.
What do you mean? Why can't...
Look, uh, Clark. I have a certain standing in the business community. Now, how's it gonna look, some college kid gonna make me look like a fool? It's humiliation. It's infamia.
There's federal officers after me.
Did you get their names?
Greenwald and Simpson. They told me that they would put me in jail for two years, unless I led them to the Gourmet Club.
No, they're not gonna, they're not gonna send you to jail.
Oh, they're not?
No, they're gonna blow your brains out.
I'm getting too old for this nonsense.
Carmine said one boy, here are two!
But it's an endangered species!
Not any more. It's in New Jersey, it's fine.
[last lines]
When you finish film school, I'd like to call you, because I know a lot of people in Hollywood.
Oh, really?
Yeah. I could kick a couple of doors open for you.
Oh. Oh.
Give you a couple of opportunities.
Oh. Oh, no. No, no. You know, I... I don't know. I don't think that's necessary.
No, no, no, really. It's easy for me. I'll just make a phone call. Make it easy for you.
You promise?
Every word I say, by definition, is a promise.

[sings in German]
Mein Herz schwebt in Blut! That means 'My Heart Swims In Blood'.
Yeah.
[first lines]
Over there! Look!
Dwight?
Shh!
Dwight, don't. Don't, really.
[Dwight fires his rifle]
Hey, asshole! What are ya, nuts? You can't see the cap, it's not orange enough for ya?
[Dwight fires again]
Get out of these woods!
Well, without humor, what do we have?
What? You know how big this is? Bacio di tutti baci... the kiss of all kisses.
